metadata.title: CVE-2024-26661 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/amd/display: Add NULL test for 'timing generator' in 'dcn21_set_pipe()'In "u32 otg_inst = pipe_ctx->stream_res.tg->inst;" pipe_ctx->stream_res.tgcould be NULL, it is relying on the caller to ensure the tg is not NULL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26661` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-44-generic - 6.5.0-44.44~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-44-generic - 6.5.0-44.44~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-44-generic-64k - 6.5.0-44.44~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-aws - 6.5.0-1023.23~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1024-azure - 6.5.0-1024.25~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1024-gcp - 6.5.0-1024.26~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-44-lowlatency - 6.5.0-44.44.1~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-44-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-44.44.1~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1026-oracle - 6.5.0-1026.26~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1026-oracle-64k - 6.5.0-1026.26~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1027-oem - 6.5.0-1027.28
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1017-starfive - 6.5.0-1017.18~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-nvidia - 6.5.0-1023.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1023-nvidia-64k - 6.5.0-1023.24
No subscription required
